content:
Run a Macro

You can run a macro to automate a series of repetitive keystrokes that you usually perform manually when working with records. This includes tasks like updating the case status or sending an email with a survey link.

Available in: Salesforce Classic (Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions), Lightning Experience (Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions)

User permissions needed:
* Read on macros
* Create AND Edit on macros
* Manage Macros That Users Can’t Undo (for irreversible macros)

Open the record you want to perform the macro on.
Open the Macros widget or utility.
Search or navigate to a macro, and select it from the list.
Review the macro’s description and instructions.
Run the macro in Salesforce Classic by clicking , or in Lightning Experience by clicking Run Macro.

A message displays indicating whether the macro ran successfully. A green dot appears next to each instruction that ran successfully, while a red dot and error message appear next to any unsuccessful instructions.
title: Automating Tasks with Macros in Service Cloud
